result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Montemayor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No contact with the co-defendant's Robert Brown and Steven Robinson.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, including child care.  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 03-04-2016.
REPORT DATE CHANGED FROM MARCH 4, 2016 TO MARCH 14, 2016 AT 6:00 PM.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph A Montemayor in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant's wife addresses the Court.   The Defendant was given the following:

Count #2:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No contact with:  co-defendant's Robert Brown and Steven Robinson.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Any terms deemed appropriate by agent.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 60 days non working hours. Release for childcare. Defendant to report to the huber facility by 6:00 p.m on March 4, 2016. 

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 200 Hours.    

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 02-24-2016 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
